column7: How often do you use social apps?
column8: What is your most used social app? What about it do you like?
column9: Have you used location based apps before? (SnapChat Maps, Pokemon Go, etc.)
column10: How comfortable are you with location tracking in apps?
column11: I agree to consent to the above.

column8: Instagram because I like staying updated with the people around me (friends, family, aquaintances). I also spend a lot of my time on the instagram explore page where I can see suggested content-- people I may know + their posts, events happening around me, things the algorithm think I enjoy engaging with like food reels, EE jokes, beauty recommendations.
column10: Depends on what app it is

column8: Probably instagram or tiktok. I like that these apps allow me to silently watch people's lives without needing to respond/ react to it. It makes me feel more connected to my general circle of friends + family and helps to keep me informed about current world events, more personal events (friends traveling adventures, what's trending, suggestions for where I should explore near me-- places, restaurants, activities, etc.).

I really like instagram. Gives me a lot of fun content to look at. I mainly use the explore page where I can see things the algorithm thinks I enjoy watching-- makeup, shopping deals, outfits, pretty places, nice restaurants, recipes. I really like that it builds a sense of community. HM-- beli is really cool too, its an app where you can rate restaurants you've eaten at but with more social engagement to it than yelp (follow people, see friends resturant galleries, etc).
column10: Depends on what app it is

column8: I use instagram and snapchat the most. Instagram because seeing what other people are up to is entertaining-- makes me feel like I am a watching everyone's life movie-- and I also really like the curated feed instagram collects on my explore page. Snapchat is fun cause I like snapping my close friends (sending pictures back and forth). I get a daily look into what they are doing at times in the day and feels a little more personal than instagram.
column10: Depends on what app it is

column8: I use tikok the most because of its addictive nature-- endless mindless scrolling. The algorithm does a really good job of curating content for what it thinks I like-- places to eat near me, relatable content, outfit inspiration, etc.
column10: Depends on what app it is
